**Government Tender Announcement: Pusher Furnace**

* **File Title:** 23240-230197 RFP Pusher Furnace
* **Bid Reference Number:** WS3639695979-3728032642
* **Modification Number:** 3
* **Public Posting Date:** October 28, 2022
* **Bid Closing Date:**

As a reminder, please disregard the previously set response deadline and closing time on the Ariba Discovery posting and Buyandsell posting. All required supporting documentation and bid submissions must be submitted by December 14, 2022 at 2:00 p.m. EST. Any bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive.

**Bid Opportunity:**

Natural Resources Canada has a requirement for a Pusher Furnace, in accordance with Annex A. This opportunity is available on SAP Ariba, and the link can be found at: [http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14493014](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14493014).

**Bid Submission Requirements:**

* Please submit all required supporting documentation and bid submissions by December 14, 2022 at 2:00 p.m. EST.
* Any bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive.

**Trade Agreements:**

* This bid opportunity is open to all eligible bidders under the following trade agreements:
	+ World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
	+ Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
	+ Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
	+ Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
	+ Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
	+ Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
	+ Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
	+ Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
	+ Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
	+ Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
	+ Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)

**Bid Evaluation Criteria:**

* The bid will be evaluated based on the lowest price submitted.

**Regulatory Information:**

* This bid opportunity is governed by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).
* The end user is the Department of Natural Resources (NRCan).
* Contact Erin O'Neill at [erin.oneill@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:erin.one
